name: MCEditHelp
tagline: A guide to adding 3d printed files to Minecraft.
body:
# Guide to Adding .stl files to Minecraft
Have you ever wanted to build something in Minecraft without building? You can. 

![Image of CoderDojo Logo](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/merlin04/mcedithelp/result.png)

## Step 1: Create the .schematic file for importing it into Minecraft
To do this, you will use Tinkercad. 

1. Sign up for Tinkercad.

2. Go onto [Thingiverse](http://thingiverse.com) and find a model. If you want a CoderDojo logo, [click here](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/merlin04/mcedithelp/coderdojo_logo.stl). Please note that this logo is not in color.

3. Create a new project.

![Create a Project](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/merlin04/mcedithelp/create.png)

4. Click "Browse" and find your model you just downloaded. Then, click "Import". 

![Importing a .stl](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/merlin04/mcedithelp/import.png)

5. Click "Download for Minecraft" from the menu "Design".

6. Click "Export". 

![Download for Minecraft Menu](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/merlin04/mcedithelp/downloadfor.png)

7. Save the file somewhere. 

## Step 2: Install MCEdit
MCEdit will allow you to modify your Minecraft world in ways you usually can't. 

1. Go to [mcedit.net](http://mcedit.net)

2. Click "Download MCEdit".

3. Click "Click here to download MCEdit 1.0".

4. Select your OS. 

5. Run the installer. This step will vary depending on your OS. For Linux, it is more complicated than it is for other OSes.

## Step 3: Prepare a Minecraft world. 

This step is simple. 

1. Create a Minecraft world. 

2. Quit Minecraft.

## Step 4: Add the .schematic into Minecraft

This is also easy. 

1. Launch MCEdit, and click "Quick Load". 

2. Select your world and click "Load".

3. Press the 6 key. 

4. Find your .schematic file and click "Open". 

5. Drag the item to somewhere you want. 

6. Press enter.

7. Press Esc.

8. Click "Quit".

## Step 5: See your work!

Open your Minecraft world. You will see the item!

![The Result](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/merlin04/mcedithelp/result.png)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
